      • clone

        public ProducerBuilder<T> clone()
        Description copied from interface: ProducerBuilder
        Create a copy of the current ProducerBuilder.

        Cloning the builder can be used to share an incomplete configuration and specialize it multiple times. For example: 

         ProducerBuilder builder = client.newProducer().sendTimeout(10, TimeUnit.SECONDS).blockIfQueueFull(true);

 Producer producer1 = builder.clone().topic(TOPIC_1).create();
 Producer producer2 = builder.clone().topic(TOPIC_2).create();
        Specified by:
        clone in interface ProducerBuilder<T>
        Overrides:
        clone in class Object

      • create

        public Producer<T> create()
                   throws PulsarClientException
        Description copied from interface: ProducerBuilder
        Finalize the creation of the Producer instance.

        This method will block until the producer is created successfully.

        Specified by:
        create in interface ProducerBuilder<T>
        Returns:
        the producer instance
        Throws:
        PulsarClientException.ProducerBusyException - if a producer with the same "producer name" is already connected to the topic
        PulsarClientException - if the producer creation fails

      • createAsync

        public CompletableFuture<Producer<T>> createAsync()
        Description copied from interface: ProducerBuilder
        Finalize the creation of the Producer instance in asynchronous mode.

        This method will return a CompletableFuture that can be used to access the instance when it's ready.

        Specified by:
        createAsync in interface ProducerBuilder<T>
        Returns:
        a future that will yield the created producer instance

      • loadConf

        public ProducerBuilder<T> loadConf(Map<String,Object> config)
        Description copied from interface: ProducerBuilder
        Load the configuration from provided config map.

        Example: 

         Map<String, Object> config = new HashMap<>();
 config.put("producerName", "test-producer");
 config.put("sendTimeoutMs", 2000);

 ProducerBuilder<byte[]> builder = ...;
 builder = builder.loadConf(config);

 Producer<byte[]> producer = builder.create();
        Specified by:
        loadConf in interface ProducerBuilder<T>
        Parameters:
        config - configuration to load
        Returns:
        producer builder instance

      • topic

        public ProducerBuilder<T> topic(String topicName)

        Specify the topic this producer will be publishing on.

        This argument is required when constructing the produce.

      • producerName

        public ProducerBuilder<T> producerName(@NonNull
                                       String producerName)
        Description copied from interface: ProducerBuilder
        Specify a name for the producer

        If not assigned, the system will generate a globally unique name which can be access with Producer.getProducerName().

        When specifying a name, it is up to the user to ensure that, for a given topic, the producer name is unique across all Pulsar's clusters. Brokers will enforce that only a single producer a given name can be publishing on a topic.

        Specified by:
        producerName in interface ProducerBuilder<T>
        Parameters:
        producerName - the custom name to use for the producer

      • sendTimeout

        public ProducerBuilder<T> sendTimeout(int sendTimeout,
                                      @NonNull
                                      TimeUnit unit)
        Description copied from interface: ProducerBuilder
        Set the send timeout (default: 30 seconds)

        If a message is not acknowledged by the server before the sendTimeout expires, an error will be reported. Setting the timeout to zero, for example setTimeout(0, TimeUnit.SECONDS) will set the timeout to infinity, which can be useful when using Pulsar's message deduplication feature.

        Specified by:
        sendTimeout in interface ProducerBuilder<T>
        Parameters:
        sendTimeout - the send timeout
        unit - the time unit of the sendTimeout

      • maxPendingMessages

        public ProducerBuilder<T> maxPendingMessages(int maxPendingMessages)
        Description copied from interface: ProducerBuilder
        Set the max size of the queue holding the messages pending to receive an acknowledgment from the broker.

        When the queue is full, by default, all calls to Producer.send(T) and Producer.sendAsync(T) will fail unless blockIfQueueFull is set to true. Use ProducerBuilder.blockIfQueueFull(boolean) to change the blocking behavior.

        Specified by:
        maxPendingMessages in interface ProducerBuilder<T>
        Returns:

      • maxPendingMessagesAcrossPartitions

        public ProducerBuilder<T> maxPendingMessagesAcrossPartitions(int maxPendingMessagesAcrossPartitions)
        Description copied from interface: ProducerBuilder
        Set the number of max pending messages across all the partitions

        This setting will be used to lower the max pending messages for each partition (ProducerBuilder.maxPendingMessages(int)), if the total exceeds the configured value.

        Specified by:
        maxPendingMessagesAcrossPartitions in interface ProducerBuilder<T>

      • blockIfQueueFull

        public ProducerBuilder<T> blockIfQueueFull(boolean blockIfQueueFull)
        Description copied from interface: ProducerBuilder
        Set whether the Producer.send(T) and Producer.sendAsync(T) operations should block when the outgoing message queue is full.

        Default is false. If set to false, send operations will immediately fail with PulsarClientException.ProducerQueueIsFullError when there is no space left in pending queue.

        Specified by:
        blockIfQueueFull in interface ProducerBuilder<T>
        Parameters:
        blockIfQueueFull - whether to block Producer.send(T) and Producer.sendAsync(T) operations on queue full
        Returns:

      • messageRoutingMode

        public ProducerBuilder<T> messageRoutingMode(@NonNull
                                             MessageRoutingMode messageRouteMode)
        Description copied from interface: ProducerBuilder
        Set the message routing mode for the partitioned producer. Default routing mode is round-robin routing. This logic is applied when the application is not setting a key MessageBuilder.setKey(String) on a particular message.
        Specified by:
        messageRoutingMode in interface ProducerBuilder<T>
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        producer builder
        See Also:
        MessageRoutingMode

      • compressionType

        public ProducerBuilder<T> compressionType(@NonNull
                                          CompressionType compressionType)
        Description copied from interface: ProducerBuilder
        Set the compression type for the producer.

        By default, message payloads are not compressed. Supported compression types are:

        • CompressionType.LZ4
        • CompressionType.ZLIB
        Specified by:
        compressionType in interface ProducerBuilder<T>
        Returns:

      • hashingScheme

        public ProducerBuilder<T> hashingScheme(@NonNull
                                        HashingScheme hashingScheme)
        Description copied from interface: ProducerBuilder
        Change the HashingScheme used to chose the partition on where to publish a particular message. Standard hashing functions available are:
        • JavaStringHash: Java String.hashCode()
        • Murmur3_32Hash: Use Murmur3 hashing function. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MurmurHash
        Default is JavaStringHash.
        Specified by:
        hashingScheme in interface ProducerBuilder<T>
        Parameters:
        hashingScheme - the chosen HashingScheme

      • messageRouter

        public ProducerBuilder<T> messageRouter(@NonNull
                                        MessageRouter messageRouter)
        Description copied from interface: ProducerBuilder
        Set a custom message routing policy by passing an implementation of MessageRouter
        Specified by:
        messageRouter in interface ProducerBuilder<T>

      • enableBatching

        public ProducerBuilder<T> enableBatching(boolean batchMessagesEnabled)
        Description copied from interface: ProducerBuilder
        Control whether automatic batching of messages is enabled for the producer. default: false [No batching] When batching is enabled, multiple calls to Producer.sendAsync can result in a single batch to be sent to the broker, leading to better throughput, especially when publishing small messages. If compression is enabled, messages will be compressed at the batch level, leading to a much better compression ratio for similar headers or contents. When enabled default batch delay is set to 1 ms and default batch size is 1000 messages

        Batching is enabled by default since 2.0.0.

        Specified by:
        enableBatching in interface ProducerBuilder<T>
        Returns:
        producer builder.
        See Also:
        ProducerBuilder.batchingMaxPublishDelay(long, TimeUnit), ProducerBuilder.batchingMaxMessages(int)

      • cryptoKeyReader

        public ProducerBuilder<T> cryptoKeyReader(@NonNull
                                          CryptoKeyReader cryptoKeyReader)
        Description copied from interface: ProducerBuilder
        Sets a CryptoKeyReader
        Specified by:
        cryptoKeyReader in interface ProducerBuilder<T>
        Parameters:
        cryptoKeyReader - CryptoKeyReader object

      • addEncryptionKey

        public ProducerBuilder<T> addEncryptionKey(@NonNull
                                           String key)
        Description copied from interface: ProducerBuilder
        Add public encryption key, used by producer to encrypt the data key. At the time of producer creation, Pulsar client checks if there are keys added to encryptionKeys. If keys are found, a callback getKey(String keyName) is invoked against each key to load the values of the key. Application should implement this callback to return the key in pkcs8 format. If compression is enabled, message is encrypted after compression. If batch messaging is enabled, the batched message is encrypted.
        Specified by:
        addEncryptionKey in interface ProducerBuilder<T>

      • cryptoFailureAction

        public ProducerBuilder<T> cryptoFailureAction(@NonNull
                                              ProducerCryptoFailureAction action)
        Description copied from interface: ProducerBuilder
        Sets the ProducerCryptoFailureAction to the value specified
        Specified by:
        cryptoFailureAction in interface ProducerBuilder<T>
        Parameters:
        action - producer action

      • batchingMaxPublishDelay

        public ProducerBuilder<T> batchingMaxPublishDelay(long batchDelay,
                                                  @NonNull
                                                  TimeUnit timeUnit)
        Description copied from interface: ProducerBuilder
        Set the time period within which the messages sent will be batched default: 1 ms if batch messages are enabled. If set to a non zero value, messages will be queued until this time interval or until
        Specified by:
        batchingMaxPublishDelay in interface ProducerBuilder<T>
        Parameters:
        batchDelay - the batch delay
        timeUnit - the time unit of the batchDelay
        Returns:
        See Also:
        threshold is reached; all messages will be published as a single batch message. The consumer will be delivered individual messages in the batch in the same order they were enqueued

      • batchingMaxMessages

        public ProducerBuilder<T> batchingMaxMessages(int batchMessagesMaxMessagesPerBatch)
        Description copied from interface: ProducerBuilder
        Set the maximum number of messages permitted in a batch. default: 1000 If set to a value greater than 1, messages will be queued until this threshold is reached or batch interval has elapsed
        Specified by:
        batchingMaxMessages in interface ProducerBuilder<T>
        Parameters:
        batchMessagesMaxMessagesPerBatch - maximum number of messages in a batch
        Returns:
        See Also:
        All messages in batch will be published as a single batch message. The consumer will be delivered individual messages in the batch in the same order they were enqueued

      • initialSequenceId

        public ProducerBuilder<T> initialSequenceId(long initialSequenceId)
        Description copied from interface: ProducerBuilder
        Set the baseline for the sequence ids for messages published by the producer.

        First message will be using (initialSequenceId + 1) as its sequence id and subsequent messages will be assigned incremental sequence ids, if not otherwise specified.

        Specified by:
        initialSequenceId in interface ProducerBuilder<T>
        Returns:
